title: Portion of Ocean Path closed until further notice
description: Approximately 400 feet of Ocean Path is closed between Otter Cliff and Otter Point for repairs. Pedestrians should follow detour signs to walk along a portion of Park Loop Road currently closed to vehicles.

title: Historic carriage roads closed until further notice for "mud season"
description: Spring thaw has led to temporary closures to protect Acadia's historic carriage roads during "mud season." Walking, bicycling or riding horses in these wet and soft conditions can cause costly ruts and potholes that channel water and exacerbate erosion.

title: Several trails closed for Peregrine falcon nesting season
description: Until further notice, typically mid-August, Penobscot East Trail, Jordan Cliffs Trail, Precipice Trail, and Valley Cove Trail are closed for Peregrine falcon nesting season. Also, as roads reopen, the Precipice Trail parking lot will remain closed.

title: Trail and Parking Area Re-Opened - Mt. Alava Trail
description: Mt. Alava trail and parking area are now open to the public. Access to the summit from the Alava Trailhead is strictly prohibited due to serious risks. Death or serious injury can occur. Mt. Alava summit remains accessible from the Old Vatia trail.

title: General Mosquito Information
description: Although there is no known current transmission of dengue, Zika, or chikungunya, American Samoa has had recent outbreaks, and reintroduction is possible. Avoid mosquito bites and report to your doctor if you get sick within two weeks of returning.

title: Temporary closure of Fiery Furnace
description: Fiery Furnace is temporarily closed. No ranger-led tours nor self-guided permits will be issued until further notice. We look forward to offering these services soon.

title: Reduced picnic facilities throughout the park
description: Some trash cans and picnic tables have been removed to reduce maintenance workloads. We apologize for any inconvenience this causes.

title: Timed Entry Reservation Pilot 2025
description: To enter the park April 1–July 6 and August 28–October 31, 2025, most visitors will need a Timed Entry Ticket. Tickets may be purchased from Recreation.gov up to six months ahead. Starting March 31, extra tickets will release at 7pm for next-day visits.

title: Navigation
description: Do not rely on GPS digital navigation systems to find your way to Badlands National Park. Please note that the Visitor Center at 25216 Ben Reifel Road, Interior SD 57750 is located just off I-90.

title: Big Bend Spring = Full Campgrounds
description: March is the busiest time of the year in Big Bend. Please plan ahead and do NOT travel all the way to Big Bend without camping/lodging arrangements. Be prepared for full parking and busy facilities. Select "more" below for further details.

title: Panther Junction Convenience Store Closed for Remodel
description: The Panther Junction convenience store located at the Panther Junction gas station is closed for remodeling. Gas/diesel pumps remain open and available 24/7. Gas/diesel is also available at Rio Grande Village from 8:00 AM to 9:00 PM.

title: Pardon Our Dust: Chisos Basin Improvement Projects to Begin in July
description: Work on two large construction projects in the Chisos Basin will begin in July 2025 and continue for approximately two years. Major disruptions in visitor access to the Chisos Basin are expected during this time. Big Bend National Park will remain OPEN.

title: Temporary Trail Closure to Protect Nesting Falcons
description: From February 1st through May 31st, a portion of the East Rim Trail in the Chisos Mountains will be closed to protect nesting falcons. The closure includes East Rim backpacking campsites ER-4, 5, 6, 7, 8, 9. For details and a map, click "more."

title: Big Bend is a NO DRONE Zone
description: The use of drones is prohibited in Big Bend National Park. Thank you for preserving the peace and tranquility of Big Bend.

title: Bringing a Pet to Big Bend?
description: Bringing your pet to Big Bend National Park will limit some of your park explorations and opportunities. Pets are not allowed on park trails, in the backcountry, or on the river. Pets are allowed only where vehicles can go. Pets may not be left unattended

title: Boca Chita Historic District
description: Work on the Boca Chita Lighthouse will begin Monday 01/20/2025.  During this project the lighthouse will be closed to the public and scaffolding will be erected temporarily obscuring views of this iconic landmark.  Updates will be provided when available.

title: Camping and Docking at Boca Chita and Elliott Keys
description: Docking at Boca Chita and Elliott Keys: $25.00 Friday - Monday and Federal Holidays Camping at Boca Chita and Elliott Keys: $35.00 per night. Payments must be made on site using the recreation.gov phone app.

title: Ride Share Services
description: Convoy Point grounds, Jetty Trail, kayak launch, and picnic area open at 7 a.m. and close at 5:30 p.m. If you are using a ride share service for transportation to and from the park, ensure ride share services can be onsite before closing time.

title: Boater Awareness
description: Please use caution in park waters due to navigational markers that may be missing or moved due to unforeseen circumstances.

title: North Rim spring opening delayed
description: Due to a delay in contracting for road maintenance, we estimate that the North Rim Road will be open by mid-May. Until then, all North Rim facilities will remain closed, and the road will remain closed and gated at the park boundary.

title: East Portal Road closed for winter
description: East Portal Road is closed, and will reopen in spring as conditions permit. East Portal Road reopening is determined by the Bureau of Reclamation.

title: Campground Closures
description: All campgrounds are closed until further notice.

title: South Rim Drive closed for winter
description: South Rim Drive is closed past the South Rim Visitor Center. Until there is enough snow for grooming, it will remain open for pedestrians and bicycles.

title: No Water Available
description: Water systems throughout the park are shut off for the winter season. Plan ahead and bring all drinking water.

title: South Rim Road construction continuing in 2025
description: Major road improvement projects are complete for 2024. Construction will continue in 2025. Expect delays, alternating one-way traffic, and parking lot closures.

title: Temporary Trail Closure
description: For safety reasons, the connector trail from Bryce Point to Peekaboo Loop is closed due to severe icy conditions. Peekaboo Loop may still be accessed from the Two Bridges side of Navajo Loop and the Figure 8 Combination Trail.

title: Bryce Canyon is Open - No Reservations Required to Enter
description: No reservations are required to enter Bryce Canyon National Park at any time of year. Simply pay your park entrance fee or present your America the Beautiful pass upon arrival.

title: Winter Trail Closures
description: The Connecting Trail from Bryce Point to the Peekaboo Loop and the Wall Street side of Navajo Loop are closed for the winter season. The Two Bridges side of Navajo Loop remains open year-round, allowing access to Peekaboo Loop and Queen's Garden.

title: Expect long lines to enter the park
description: Between March and November, particularly on busy holiday weekends, you may experience long lines at the entrance road. Parking lots at popular trailheads and viewpoints will fill early. Pack your patience and arrive early to avoid crowds.

title: Difficult conditions complicate Cataract Canyon takeouts
description: Hite Ramp is closed. The North Wash take-out is a primitive, unimproved dirt take-out. You will not be able to back a trailer down the dirt slope. Recent washouts have further deteriorated conditions.

title: Scenic Drive Rehabilitation Project
description: The Scenic Drive is open through Capitol Gorge. Please drive carefully in construction areas. The road will fully close again in the spring, dates to be determined.

title: Special Use Permits
description: Special Use Permits are typically needed for activities that benefit a specific group. Examples include: Groups of 40 or more, trips organized by scouting groups, churches, or academic institutions, photography, weddings, and first amendment activities

title: Closures Due to Flood Damage
description: Some areas of the park including Walnut Canyon Desert Drive and some trails remain closed after extensive flood damage. The main park road to the visitor center and cavern is open.

title: High Fire Danger
description: Due to high fire danger, there are multiple closures and prohibited activities. The main park road to Carlsbad Cavern and the visitor center is open.

title: Items Worn or Used in Other Caves Not Allowed
description: A disease known as White-Nose Syndrome is killing bats in North America. To prevent it from spreading to our bats, do not wear shoes, clothing, or bring any gear into any cave at Carlsbad Caverns National Park that were in another cave.

title: Timed Entry Ticket Required to Enter Carlsbad Cavern
description: Reservations are highly recommended and can be purchased by clicking "more" or calling 877-444-6777. Reservations only select the entry time. Upon arrival at the visitor center, an entrance pass must be purchased.

title: Footwear in the Cavern
description: For safety, closed-toe shoes with good traction are recommended. Flip flops, sandals, and some walking shoes have little or no traction and increase the possibility of slips, trips, and falls. Watch your step and use the handrails when necessary.

title: Unmanned Aircraft (Drones) Are Prohibited
description: The use of unmanned aircraft, also known as drones, is prohibited within Carlsbad Caverns National Park.

title: Temporary Closure on Santa Rosa Island
description: The beaches and dunes of China Camp and Cluster Point, and area in-between, are temporarily closed to all visitor access for the protection of sensitive resources. Travel is allowed on marked paths.

title: Santa Barbara Island Dock Closed; Landings Restricted to Adjacent Rocky Ledge
description: Santa Barbara Island is open to public access, but landings are restricted to the rocky ledge adjacent to the dock. The dock is closed and is not expected to be repaired in the near future due to the severe winter storm damage.

title: Boardwalk Construction Underway at Sections D & F (Updated 3/29/2025)
description: Sections D, E, and F of the Boardwalk east of the Sims Trail are currently closed for planned removal and replacement. Weston Lake Trail is currently an out and back trail. Please see our trail information page for more details.

title: 2025 Firefly Viewing Event Lottery Dates Announced
description: Please see linked News Release for more details!

title: Backcountry Trail Conditions
description: GPS is necessary on backcountry trails: Oakridge, River, and Kingsnake. These trails may be difficult to follow. River Trail is not recommended at this time due to the volume of downed trees and debris from recent storms.

title: Please Email if Unable to Reach by Phone
description: Park phones are experiencing technical issues at this time. If unable to reach by phone, please feel free to email cong_information@nps.gov with any questions.

title: Planning Ahead for Transportation
description: If being dropped off at the park, please ensure you will have a return ride. Taxis and rideshares do not often come out to Congaree, and the bus may be unavailable. Please plan ahead.

title: Travel on Hwy 62 through the Park is NOT Advised
description: Travel on Hwy 62 through the park is not advised at this time. The park is experiencing issues with several pieces of snow plowing equipment making it difficult to keep the roadway clear for travel.

title: Road from Park Headquarters to Rim Village is Temporarily CLOSED
description: The road from Park HQ to Rim Village is currently closed due to the latest winter storm. It is not currently possible to get a lake view by vehicle. All Oregon Chain Laws apply.

title: Park's Voicemail System is Not Working
description: The park's voicemail system is not working at this time. Please email us at craterlake@nps.gov if you need to leave a message. Thank you for your patience.

title: Icy Roads - Please Use Caution!
description: The open roads in the park have lots of icy patches. Please drive slowly and with caution. All Oregon Chain Laws apply.

title: North Entrance Road and Rim Drive are CLOSED for the season.
description: The North Entrance Road and East & West Rim Drives are now closed for the season a few The roads will not open again until mid to late June or July 2025. All other roads are open.

title: No Gasoline is Available in the Park
description: The gas pumps at Mazama Village are CLOSED for the season. Please plan ahead and fill up your tank before heading to the park.

title: Trail Closures Due to the Middle Fork Fire
description: The Bald Crater Loop, Bert Creek and Boundary Springs Trails are closed until further notice due to potentially hazardous conditions created by the Middle Fork Fire. The Pacific Crest Trail through the park is now completely open for hikers.

title: Towpath and Valley trails south of Red Lock
description: Trails will be temporarily closed between Red Lock Trailhead and Brandywine Creek from Monday, March 3, to Friday, May 2, 2025 for installation of a new Brandywine Creek culvert. No detour is available.

title: Expect Crowding
description: Parking lots and popular destinations are crowded especially on weekends and days with warm weather between 10 am and 3 pm.

title: Current East Rim Trail Status
description: Click "more" to find out if the East Rim trails are open today. In good conditions the trails are open 6 am-11 pm for bikers and as posted for other trail users. In wet or hazardous conditions, the trail will close to all users to prevent damage.

title: Vehicle Break-in and Theft Warning
description: Car break-ins in Cuyahoga Valley have tripled since 2022, resulting in theft of personal items like credit cards. Do not leave valuables in your car. As a last resort, lock items in your trunk before arriving. Thieves target parking lots regularly.

title: Former Golf Course Property
description: The former golf course property in Peninsula, including a section of the Valley Trail, is closed during environmental remediation.

title: Emigrant Canyon Rd/Wildrose Area Closed Jan 6- Apr 30
description: Emigrant Canyon Road will be temporarily closed for repair work to minimize future flood damage. No access to: Wildrose Charcoal Kilns, campgrounds (Wildrose, Thorndike and Mahogany Flat), trails (Wildrose and Telescope Peak) or dirt sideroads.

title: Mud Canyon Road closed 3/24 - 4/11
description: Mud Canyon Road will be closed 3/24 - 4/11 for repairs. Access to Beatty, NV and Daylight Pass Road is still open via Beatty Cut-Off Road.

title: Gas Pumps at Panamint Springs Resort are Closed at Night
description: Gasoline is available at Panamint Springs Resort from 7am-9:30pm, daily. Gas is available at Furnace Creek and Stovepipe Wells 24hrs.

title: Road Open To: Mile 13 (Mountain Vista)
description: The Denali Park Road is open to Mile 13, Mountain Vista. Wintry conditions beyond that point prevent vehicle travel, though pedestrian travel is permitted.

title: Park Operations Altered Due to Pretty Rocks Landslide
description: Summer access to facilities and services in Denali remains altered due to the Pretty Rocks Landslide and the associated closure of the Park Road at Mile 43. Check here for more information on what to expect.

title: Bush Key is closed until Fall 2025
description: Bush Key (including the shoreline beyond the seaplane) is closed to support breeding and nesting activities colonies of Sooty Terns and Brown Noddies. The island will reopen in the fall.

title: Moat Wall is closed for repairs until Fall 2026
description: The entire moat wall will be closed for repair and strengthening of the Fort Jefferson counterscarp (moat wall) damaged by Hurricane Irma in 2017 and Hurricane Ian in 2022. Additional damage occurred from hurricanes in 2024.

title: Migrant Notice
description: Like elsewhere in the Florida Keys, we have seen an increase in Cuban migrants arriving by boat from Cuba and landing on the islands of Dry Tortugas National Park. You may observe migrant landings at the park and visitor areas may be impacted.

title: Garden Key Harbor Light
description: Vessel operators - the Garden Key Harbor Light is undergoing repairs and is extinguished. At this time it is unknown when the light will again be illuminated.

title: Click on "view all alerts" below for important details on accessing the park
description: Construction on Tamiami Trail may cause minor delays. If you have a scheduled tour, please plan accordingly. Smoke impacts from park wildfires are possible along Main Park Road. Please use caution.

title: Pa-Hay-Okee Overlook Trail closed for replacement project until Fall 2025
description: The Pa-Hay-Okee boardwalk trail, tower and parking lot will be closed for a replacement project until the fall. This is to replace aging infrastructure. The road remains open as a turnaround.

title: Paurotis Pond is closed for wading bird nesting season until Summer 2025
description: Paurotis Pond, including the boat launch, the pond, and the area beyond the parking area adjacent to the pond, is closed until further notice to limit human disturbance to nesting wading birds like Great Egrets. The parking lot remains open for viewing.

title: Gulf Coast canoe/kayak launch and visitor center closed during construction
description: Alternate launch sites for backcountry access include the Rod & Gun Club, Outdoor Resorts of Chokoloskee, and Chokoloskee Island Park and Marina. Fees at these sites vary. Call the park information line at 305-242-7700 for more information.

title: Road construction on approach to park's Homestead entrance
description: Roadwork is underway along State Road 9336 leading to the Homestead entrance of the park, approaching the Ernest F. Coe Visitor Center. Drivers may experience short delays and should watch for personnel, construction equipment, and slowdowns.

title: Roadwork may cause delays on US 41/Tamiami Trail
description: Current roadwork is ongoing along the park's northern boundary on US Highway 41/Tamiami Trail to raise the road for Everglades Restoration benefits. Drivers may experience up to 15-minute delays and should watch for personnel, equipment and slow downs.

title: For entrance fees, we accept digital passes and credit/debit cards
description: Digital passes or credit/debit cards are the ONLY method of payment at all fee collection areas. Pre-paid digital passes are available online and may be purchased in advance.

title: Operational Changes
description: The Fairbanks Alaska Public Lands Information Center will be closed Saturdays and Sundays. At this time, we are unable to accommodate mail requests for information. If you have questions or an urgent need, please contact us at (907) 459-3730.

title: Old Courthouse Closed for Renovations
description: The Old Courthouse at Gateway Arch National Park is undergoing renovations as part of the $380-million CityArchRiver project, which is the largest public-private partnership in the history of the National Park Service. It is closed to all visitors.

title: Tuesday, April 1, 2025 - Chance of Snow —South Rim High 46°F (8°C) —Low: 21°F (-6°C)
description: Trail Alerts and Closures: Bright Angel Trail below Havasupai Gardens, including the Silver Bridge CLOSED. River Trail CLOSED. Plateau Point and Plateau Point Trail CLOSED. Hikers visit this link for weather forecast and inner canyon water availability.

title: What's Closed and What's Open? (Park Operational Updates) Tuesday, April 1, 2025
description: South Rim Visitor Center is open today from 9 am to 4 pm. Follow link for a list of visitor services with hours of operation. Midday South Entrance lines are long. Arrive before 9 am or after 4 pm for shorter wait times. The North Rim reopens on May 15.

title: Cave tours offered as available
description: Through April 13th, tours of Lehman Caves will be offered as staffing permits, on a walk-up basis. Inquire about daily availability at the Lehman Caves Visitor Center.

title: Cashless Operations
description: Great Basin National Park operations have become cashless effective 03/01/2025. Campgrounds accept payment via recreation.gov or you can pay with credit/debit at the Lehman Caves Visitor Center. Cave tours accept credit/debit for walk-up tickets.

title: Wheeler Peak Scenic Drive Winter Closure
description: The Wheeler Peak Scenic Drive is closed at mile 3, Upper Lehman Creek Campground, for the winter season. For information on other closures, click more...

title: No Potable Water in Park Campgrounds
description: There currently is no water available in any campground in Great Basin National Park.  Water is available at the Lehman Caves Visitor Center, Great Basin Visitor Center, and local businesses.

title: Traction Devices Recommended for Mosca Pass Trail
description: Due to slush and spring snowmelt water that freezes at night, there are currently icy sections at higher elevations of the Mosca Pass Trail. Traction devices are recommended for safety. This alert does not affect dunes exploration.

title: Seasonal closures in effect for some park roads
description: Kuwohi Rd (formerly Clingmans Dome Rd), Parson Branch Rd, Rich Mountain Rd, Little Greenbrier Rd to the schoolhouse, and Roaring Fork Motor Nature Trail are closed for the season.

title: High Fire Danger and Fire Ban
description: Due to high fire danger throughout the park, a fire ban has been put into place. As a result, the lighting of campfires and charcoal grills is not allowed at this time.

title: Cosby Entrance Road closed for construction
description: Rehabilitation began on December 9 for the 2.3-mile-long Cosby Entrance Road from TN State Route 32 to the gate of Cosby Campground. While crews are working, the entrance road is closed to the public. The work is projected to be completed in spring 2025.

title: Most visitors need a parking tag
description: All vehicles parking for longer than 15 minutes require a parking tag. Three tag durations are available for purchase for all vehicle sizes and types: Daily ($5), Weekly ($15), or Annual ($40).

title: Guadalupe Mountains National Park Moves to “High” Fire Danger Rating
description: In addition to park fire regulations: . Smoking limited to inside a vehicle. · No open fires (this includes wood, charcoal and/or gas fire pits) are permitted anywhere in the park. · Use of gas canister stoves for cooking are still allowed at this time

title: Williams Ranch Road Closed
description: The Williams Ranch Road is currently impassable and closed to public access due to unsafe conditions.

title: Devil's Hall is a Strenuous Hike
description: The hike to Devil's Hall is rated as strenuous. The portion of the route in the wash requires rock scrambling and is dangerous when wet or if water is present. The wash surface is loose gravel and rocks and may be unstable.

title: Portion of Kekaulike Avenue in Kula to close for approximately nine months
description: A portion of Kekaulike Avenue (Route 377) between Waiakoa Road and ʻAlae Road will be closed for 24 hours, seven days a week, for approximately nine months.

title: Drive Cautiously - Endangered Birds on Roadway
description: Nēnē (Hawaiian geese) and ʻuaʻu (Hawaiian petrel) are nesting in the park and may land on or frequent park roads, parking lots, and road leading up to the park. Drivers are reminded to drive at the posted speed limits and exercise caution.

title: Kīlauea eruption
description: The eruption within Halema'uma'u crater at the summit of Kīlauea volcano ended on 3/26/25. No molten lava or night time glow is visible at this time. Volcanic activity can change at any time. Stay out of closed areas.

title: Kīlauea Visitor Center (KVC) Closed for Extensive Renovation
description: The Welcome Center is now open at Kilauea Military Camp while the Kīlauea Visitor Center undergoes renovations. Park rangers and the Hawaiʻi Pacific Parks Association park store are available from 9 a.m. to 4:45 p.m. daily.

title: Small void at Wahinekapu (Steaming Bluff)
description: A steam vent about 3 inches wide has opened in the ground near the overlook at Wahinekapu/Steaming Bluff and is emitting scalding hot steam. A small area near the overlook is roped off for safety.

title: Construction Closures and Delays
description: Expect closures and delays at the summit of Kīlauea due to a two-year construction project to repair or remove damaged buildings and infrastructure.

title: Yellow Jacket (Vespula) Wasp Activity
description: Be aware of aggressive ground-nesting vespula wasps. When threatened, leave the area. If stung and you begin to experience serious symptoms or allergic reactions, call 911.

title: Temporary Trail Closure
description: Paul H. Douglas Trail is closed today, March 27, 2025.

title: Partial Closures of Calumet Bike Trail
description: Due to recent re-construction efforts, partial closures of the Calumet Bike Trail will be in effect through this fall and sometime next year. Please use caution if riding on the trail (see below) and off the trail (because of the closures).

title: Partial Trail Closure at Portage Lakefront and Riverwalk
description: Closed portion of Portage Lakefront and Riverwalk Trail along Burns Waterway due to unsafe conditions from erosional damage. This trail portion will remain closed while funding is sought for repair work. Pier access remains open on either side of closure.

title: Island Closed from November 1 through April 15 Annually
description: From November 1 - April 15 annually, Isle Royale and its surrounding islands are closed to all visitors. Lake Superior waters are open to boaters. All islands reopen April 16. Call (906) 482-0984 to discuss trip planning, obtain permits, or pay fees.

title: Visitor Centers are Closed for the Season
description: All park visitor centers have closed for the season. This includes the Houghton, Rock Harbor, & Windigo Visitor Centers. For trip planning assistance, contact the park at (906) 482-0984.

title: New Food Storage Guidelines to Reduce Human - Wildlife Interactions
description: In response to wolves accessing human food and garbage in and around Rock Harbor and campgrounds located on the east end of the island, new food storage guidelines to ensure the safety of visitors and wildlife are in effect.

title: West Entrance Closure Starting April 7
description: The west entrance of Joshua Tree National Park will be closed to all vehicle traffic beginning 6 a.m. Monday April 7 through 6 p.m. Thursday April 10. Park Boulevard will be closed to traffic for six miles from the west entrance to Quail Springs

title: Cholla Cactus Garden Closure
description: Cholla Cactus Garden Trail will be closed daily from December 2024 - April 2025 to improve the conditions of the loop trail.

title: Inaccurate Third-Party Apps
description: Some third-party hiking apps are providing inaccurate trail and safety information to users. Please use the official NPS app for accurate information.

title: Road to Exit Glacier Closed to Automobiles
description: The Alaska Department of Transportation has closed Herman Leirer Road for winter. Therefore, the road to Exit Glacier under the National Park Service is closed as well. Reopening is typically in mid to late-May, with variation due snow and weather.

title: Use Caution in and around Pedersen Lagoon
description: On August 7, 2024, a landslide triggered tsunami washed over portions of Pedersen Lagoon near Aialik Bay (59.8842N, -149.7309W). We recommend caution for those visiting the area in and around Pedersen Lagoon. Click more for additional information.

title: Canyon from Toe of Exit Glacier to the Outwash Plain
description: The canyon from the toe of Exit Glacier to where Exit Creek opens into the Outwash Plain is susceptible to sudden outburst flood events. These events produce sudden surges of water, ice and rock. The canyon is dangerous and travel is not recommended.

title: Toe of Exit Glacier, Ice Fall Hazard Zone
description: An ice fall hazard zone has been identified at the toe and sides of Exit Glacier, due to tall blocks and slabs of ice. For your safety, entry into this zone is prohibited. Please do not continue past ice fall hazard signs and see photo for more details.

title: Several Small Roads Closed Due to Roadway Damage Or Snow Accumulation
description: These roads are closed due to roadway damage during past storm events or due to snow accumulation: Crystal Cave Rd, Middle Fork Rd, Redwood Canyon Rd, South Fork Rd, Panoramic Point Rd, lower parking lot at Giant Forest Museum

title: Crescent Meadow Road and Moro Rock Loop Road Closed For the Season
description: The roads are closed to vehicle traffic for the winter season, but will remain open to winter recreation such as hiking, snowshoeing, and cross-country skiing. Roads will reopen once they have been cleared and made safe for vehicles.

title: Kings Canyon Visitor Center in Grant Grove Is Closed On Tuesdays Until Further Notice
description: We regret any inconvenience.

title: Highway 180 Access To Cedar Grove Area of Kings Canyon National Park Closed For the Season
description: Highway 180 is closed east of Hume Lake Road for the winter season. Cedar Grove is not accessible. This section of road typically reopens in late April.

title: Mineral King Road Is Closed For the Season
description: The portion of Mineral King Road inside Sequoia National Park is closed for the winter season to the general public. The road typically reopens in May on the Wednesday before Memorial Day, but could be later depending on conditions.

title: Tire Chain Restrictions in Effect
description: Chain restrictions are in effect on some park roads. All vehicles must carry chains or cables, including 4WD and AWD vehicles. Install chains when required. For current road information, call (559) 565-3341, (press 1, then 1)

title: 11/12/2024 - Lassen National Park Highway Closed
description: The main park road (Hwy 89) is closed at Kohm Yah-mah-nee Visitor Center (southwest entrance) and Loomis Plaza/Manzanita Lake (northwest entrance) for the snow season. Please use caution if driving to the park and check weather forecasts:

title: Bumpass Hell Trail Closed For Season
description: 11/12/2024 - Due to recent snowfall, the Bumpass Hell Trail has closed for the season. This is an annual closure to prevent injury from treacherous trail conditions near hydrothermal areas.

title: Visitor Phone Line Intermittent
description: You may experience problems reaching park staff via the main visitor phone line which functions intermittently. You may email the park at lavo_information@nps.gov with general park questions.

title: Lasting Effects from 2021 Dixie Fire
description: Some facilities, infrastructure, and areas remain closed; please adhere to all closure signs. In re-opened areas, hazards like fallen trees, loose/falling rock, undefined trails, and hidden stump holes exist. Click more to learn about burned area safety.

title: Wilderness Permits Now Only Available Online
description: Wilderness permits for backcountry camping can no longer be obtained in person or by mail. Wilderness permits are only available online through Recreation.gov. Permits can be reserved up to a maximum of 90 days prior to the start date.

title: Green River Ferry Status
description: The Green River Ferry status can change without advanced warning. For the most up-to-date ferry status information call 270-758-2166 or follow the Mammoth Cave Roads and Ferry Twitter/X feed: @MCNPRoadsFerry

title: Paradise Road Status: Weekly road closure Tuesday-Thursday
description: 03/31/2025 The Paradise Road is open to Longmire. All vehicles, including 4WD and AWD, must carry tire chains and be ready to use them. The road is projected to re-open Friday 04/04 at 9:00 AM but is subject to change, check back for updates.

title: No decisions have been made if timed entry reservations will be required for the 2025 summer season.
description: Currently, timed entry reservations are NOT required to enter any part of Mount Rainier National Park (last updated 3/18/25). All visitors are still required to pay the park entrance fee or use an interagency or park pass.

title: Many park roads are closed for the winter season.
description: Many park roads are closed for the winter season, including White River, Sunrise, Mowich Lake, Stevens Canyon, Westside Road, and SR410/123.

title: Always check signs on closed road gates before recreating; roads closed to all use if work underway.
description: Closed roads may be open to non-motorized vehicles like bicycles. CHECK SIGNS on closed road gates before proceeding. During snow plowing operations or when otherwise posted, park roads are closed to all use, including hiking, bicycling, skiing, etc.

title: All vehicles are required to carry tire chains Nov 1 - May 1 when traveling in the park.
description: All vehicles, including 4WD and AWD vehicles, must carry tire chains in the park during the winter season (November 1 - May 1) and be prepared to use them when tire chain requirements are posted.

title: Cunard Road delays
description: Cunard Road has been reopened. There is a section of one lane road with a traffic light. Through Memorial Day, expect delays of 3 to 5 minutes to get by this area.

title: Temporary Closures for Peregrine Nesting
description: The following established climbing management areas are closed to all public use from March 1, 2025 to July 15, 2025 to protect peregrine falcon nesting aeries: Newhalem Crag East and Newhalem Crag West (Ryan’s Wall).

title: Hozomeen Gate Remains Closed
description: Until further notice, the gate at Hozomeen will remain closed; vehicle and foot traffic across the US/Canada border is prohibited. Visitors must enter through a designated port of entry.

title: State Route 20 Closed for the Season
description: State Route 20 is closed at milepost 134 (Ross Dam Trailhead) for the season due to heavy snowfall and risk of avalanche danger. Check the WSDOT real time map for up-to-date information, https://wsdot.com/Travel/Real-time/Map/.

title: Cascade River Road Seasonal Closure
description: Cascade River Road is closed for the season at Eldorado (milepost 20). Check the road conditions page for more information.

title: Fire Closures - Trail, Area, and Camp Closures
description: For closures due to fire activity visit the Fire Closures page, including trail, area, and camp closures for current and post fire conditions.

title: Diablo Lake Boat Launch Inaccessible to Powerboats
description: Due to silt accumulation, the Diablo Lake boat launch at Colonial Creek South Campground is not usable for launching most powerboats. Expect shallow or no water at the launch ramp and the possibility of needing to carry your boat to or from the water.

title: Be Aware of Break-ins along State Route 20
description: Prevent smashed windows and theft. Break-ins are not uncommon at trailheads along State Route 20. Remove your valuables and electronics and take associated electronic cords.

title: Hurricane Ridge Road Status
description: Hurricane Ridge Road is closed. During the period of March 31 through April 30, Hurricane Ridge Road may open or close depending on road conditions, weather, and staffing. Check back here or call 360-565-3131 for updates.

title: Hoh Rain Forest area will reopen when county road is repaired - 3/13/25
description: Olympic National Park will begin restoring essential services to the Hoh Rain Forest once the Upper Hoh Road, which is maintained by Jefferson County, is safe for travel. Until then, the area is closed to all traffic, including pedestrians & bicycles.

title: Fire Restrictions Lifted, in place Moderate Fire Danger, Beginning November 25
description: Wood and charcoal fires permitted. Please monitor this website and the park social media pages for the most up to date information as conditions can change rapidly.

title: Seasonal Closures In Effect
description: Seasonal closures are in effect to protect nesting birds of prey on cliffs and rock formations in the park. Please refer to closure lists in park brochures and on the raptor advisory page for more information.

title: High Crowds & Park Capacity
description: High visitation may require limiting access to Bear Gulch and other parking areas in the park. If all parking lots reach capacity, incoming traffic will not pass the campground until space is available. This occurs most often between 8a and 3p on weekends

title: Hike and Bike Day: Newton B. Drury Scenic Parkway
description: The 1st Saturday of each month October through May the Newton B. Drury Scenic Parkway will be closed to vehicle traffic to allow for a hike and bike day. This is a great opportunity to walk your pets through the redwoods along this scenic road.

title: Trail Ridge Road is Closed to Through Travel for the Season
description: Trail Ridge Road (U.S. Hwy 34) is closed to vehicles to through travel for the season. Trail Ridge Road is closed on the east side of the park at Many Parks Curve and on the west side of the park at Colorado River Trailhead.

title: Transponder Sales Are Not Currently Available
description: Due to technical issues, transponder sales are not currently available. We apologize for any inconvenience.

title: Busy Season, parking may be limited.
description: Saguaro NP is in its busy season for the year. This means increased visitation and more limited parking. The visitor center, trails, and picnic area parking lots will fill up fast. Plan ahead and have a backup trail in case a given parking lot is full.

title: Mica View Trail work
description: Resurfacing of Mica View Trail has been postponed due to material delays. This project is a high priority & we will resume work as soon as we are able. The trail will remain open as we wait, though surfacing work has already begun. Proceed with caution.

title: Vehicle Break-Ins
description: Saguaro National Park is an urban park. Vehicle break-ins have occurred at trailheads around the park. Don't make yourself a target. Leave valuables at home, secure your vehicle, and report any suspicious activity.

title: Rideshare services should be used with caution if visiting the Tucson Mountain District
description: Rideshare services will drop visitors off at the park, but usually will not pick them back up. To avoid being stranded in the park, coordinate two-way trips before using rideshares to visit the West side. No major trails start at the visitor center.

title: Several Small Roads Closed Due to Roadway Damage Or Snow Accumulation
description: These roads are closed due to roadway damage during past storm events or due to snow accumulation: Crystal Cave Rd, Middle Fork Rd, Redwood Canyon Rd, South Fork Rd, Panoramic Point Rd, lower parking lot at Giant Forest Museum

title: Crescent Meadow Road and Moro Rock Loop Road Closed For the Season
description: The roads are closed to vehicle traffic for the winter season, but will remain open to winter recreation such as hiking, snowshoeing, and cross-country skiing. Roads will reopen once they have been cleared and made safe for vehicles.

title: Kings Canyon Visitor Center in Grant Grove Is Closed On Tuesdays Until Further Notice
description: We regret any inconvenience.

title: Highway 180 Access To Cedar Grove Area of Kings Canyon National Park Closed For the Season
description: Highway 180 is closed east of Hume Lake Road for the winter season. Cedar Grove is not accessible. This section of road typically reopens in late April.

title: Mineral King Road Is Closed For the Season
description: The portion of Mineral King Road inside Sequoia National Park is closed for the winter season to the general public. The road typically reopens in May on the Wednesday before Memorial Day, but could be later depending on conditions.

title: Tire Chain Restrictions in Effect
description: Chain restrictions are in effect on some park roads. All vehicles must carry chains or cables, including 4WD and AWD vehicles. Install chains when required. For current road information, call (559) 565-3341, (press 1, then 1)

title: Trail Closure at Rockfish Gap (Mile 105)
description: Appalachian Trail access is closed between Rockfish Gap at mile 105 of Skyline Drive to Humpback Rock in Blue Ridge Parkway due to wildfire

title: Enter the Park with a full tank of gas!
description: While gas is available at Big Meadows Wayside (mile 51), supply is often limited, and visitors should fill up their tanks before entering the Park.

title: Get Skyline Drive Status Updates
description: Sign up for Shenandoah Alerts by texting SHENALERTS to 888777. Any time there are closures, re-openings, or other important safety-related alerts, subscribers will receive a notification via text. You may unsubscribe at any time.

title: Expect Trail Repair Delays
description: Be aware of delays and hazards on trails as crews remove downed trees and repair trails from the winter storm events.

title: Skyline Drive Status
description: Click for more information.

title: Potential delays during stone wall rehabilitation project
description: The stone wall that lines Skyline Drive is being rehabilitated between miles 72.8 and 75.7. There will be a single lane closure for the duration of this work, with an established work zone that will be managed by flaggers. Visitors should expect delays.

title: Ticket Required to Hike Old Rag
description: March 1 - November 30 those wishing to hike Old Rag are required to obtain a day-use ticket before arriving.

title: Backcountry Camping Closed
description: Backcountry camping at the park is closed. There is no established opening date at this time.

title: Interdune Boardwalk Closed
description: Due to the active safety corridor, the Interdune Boardwalk is closed. Please visit the park visitor center to learn about other options during your visit.

title: Dunes Drive Safety Corridor
description: Dunes Drive is open. A safety corridor is in effect between mile marker 3 and 5.5 along Dunes Drive. Visitors may drive but not stop or exit their vehicle in this area.

title: Park Closures
description: From time to time the missile range that surrounds the park performs military testing that may require the closure of the park or Highway 70. Please plan your visit around upcoming military tests.

title: RV and Tractor Trailer Parking at the Visitor Center
description: There is limited space for parking for recreational vehicles and trailers in the parking lot directly in front (south) of the visitor center. RVs are asked to not park in the lot behind the visitor center. There is no parking space for tractor trailers.

title: Wind Cave Open for Cave Tours
description: Wind Cave is now open for cave tours. Tickets can be purchased online at least 3 days in advance at recreation.gov or can be purchased in-person the day of. Tour times include the Garden of Eden at 10:00 AM and the Fairgrounds at 1:00 PM.

title: Centennial Trailhead Parking
description: Reminder: Overnight parking without a camping permit is prohibited. Permits are not issued specifically for parking. Shuttles are available in the Black Hills for through hikers on the Centennial Trail.

title: Wind Cave moves to cashless fee collection
description: Payments for cave tours, campground fees, as well as Interagency Passes at Wind Cave National Park, will be by credit/ debit cards or digital payments only. Cash and check payments will no longer be accepted.

title: Park contact stations (visitor centers and ranger stations) closed in winter October thru April.
description: The national park and preserve public lands are open year-round, with limited access in winter. Visitor centers are open in summer but closed in Fall-Winter-Spring. Call (907) 822-7250 or email wrst_info@nps.gov for park information.

title: Most Park Roads Closed to All Vehicles
description: Spring plowing has begun and most roads are closed to all vehicles until mid-April. The road between the North and Northeast entrances remains open and is open year-round to regular vehicles.

title: Bears Coming Out of Hibernation
description: Bears are coming out of hibernation this time of year and may be spotted while out in the park. Several Bear Management Areas are also now in effect. It's important to be bear aware: carry bear spray and know how to use it!

title: Biscuit Basin Closed Due to Hydrothermal Explosion
description: The parking lot and boardwalk at Biscuit Basin, located north of Old Faithful, is closed until further notice due to the possibility of another event at the site of a hydrothermal explosion that occurred July 23, 2024.

title: Vehicle entrance reservation not needed
description: Although an entrance pass is required to enter Yellowstone National Park, vehicle reservations are not needed. You are encouraged to purchase an entrance pass before arriving, but you may also purchase passes at any entrance station upon arrival.

title: Tioga Road (Highway 120 through the park) and Glacier Point Road are closed for the winter
description: Tioga Road (continuation of Highway 120 through the park) and Glacier Point Road are closed for the season due to snow. They usually open around late May or June. Call 209/372-0200 (then 1, 1) for road conditions and tire chain requirements.

title: Seasonal Road Closure - Kolob Terrace Road past Maloney Hill
description: Kolob Terrace Road closed to non-tracked vehicles past Maloney Hill (14 miles north of SR-9) due to snow and ice.

title: Closed trail bridge at Zion Lodge (Shuttle Stop #5)
description: To access Emerald Pools, start your hike at the Grotto (Shuttle Stop #6). This does not affect other trailheads or the Zion Canyon Shuttle System.

title: Road to Lava Point and West Rim Trailhead closed
description: This is a regular, seasonal closure, and we will remove this alert when snow melts. Lava Point Overlook is also closed.

title: Weeping Rock Shuttle Bus Stop, Parking Area, and Trail Closed
description: Due to rockfall, the area near Weeping Rock is temporarily closed. Park scientists and maintenance staff are monitoring the area.

title: Toxic Cyanobacteria in the Virgin River and the streams of Zion National Park
description: Do not submerge your head in or filter drinking water from still or moving water.

title: Angels Landing Pilot Permit Program
description: Everyone who hikes Angels Landing needs to have a permit. Learn why you need a permit and how to get one. This requirement does not affect entering the park or riding the park shuttle (when it is running).

title: Please park legally and responsibly in Zion National Park and the Town of Springdale
description: Zion has limited parking space. Park only in designated stalls. Vehicles parked outside of designated stalls are subject to citation and may be towed. Once all designated parking stalls in Zion are full, visitors should park in Springdale.
